thread.title: Pluto in full colour as NASA's astonishing new planet pictures show rainbow surface of a distant world
thread.title_full: Pluto in full colour as NASA's astonishing new planet pictures show rainbow surface of a distant world - Mirror Online

author: Jeff Parsons
title: Pluto in full colour as NASA's astonishing new planet pictures show rainbow surface of a distant world
text:
NASA's New Horizons probe has been sending back ever more detailed images of Pluto since completing its historic flyby of the planet earlier this year.
The latest images, revealed yesterday, show off a high resolution colour-enhanced view of the planet.
The image combines blue, red and infrared images taken by the Multispectral Visual Imaging Camera (MVIC) on board the probe.
"Pluto’s surface sports a remarkable range of subtle colors, enhanced in this view to a rainbow of pale blues, yellows, oranges, and deep reds," said NASA.
NASA/JHUAPL/SWRI A colour-enhanced image of Pluto's surface
"Many landforms have their own distinct colors, telling a complex geological and climatological story that scientists have only just begun to decode."
Other recent pictures of the planet show it has surprisingly "Earth-like" weather conditions .
NASA/JHUAPL/SWRI NASA has been examining the surface of the distant dwarf planet
Instead of water, Pluto's climate is driven entirely by nitrogen, which has a freezing point of -210 °C and forms conditions which makes our snowstorms look snuggly.
Alan Howard, a member of the New Horizons’s Geology, Geophysics and Imaging team from the University of Virginia, Charlottesville, said he "did not expect" to see such a familar weather system in "the frigid conditions of the outer solar system".
NASA/JHUAPL/SWRI New Horizons has captured vast amounts of detail about Pluto
"Driven by dim sunlight, this would be directly comparable to the hydrological cycle that feeds ice caps on Earth, where water is evaporated from the oceans, falls as snow, and returns to the seas through glacial flow," he added.
“Pluto is surprisingly Earth-like in this regard and no one predicted it.”
